questions.text: 8.  a) Machine learning subject of 9 students marks as follows:  6 60, 61,68,63,65,64,62,62,55. Calculate central tendency, percentiles to represent the data in box plots.

b) A key step in any predictive analytics project is deciding which type of predictive 6 analytics model to use. Explain four types of approaches learned based on their mathematical foundation ****** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B.Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Subject Title : Web Application Development Subject Code: B18CS7010 - 26721 Time: 90 Minutes                                          Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each unit.  Marks UNIT – I

1. a) A student who is new to Web Programing wants to know the various HTML Tags, with 5 suitable example explain the following HTML tags to him. i).

ii).
iii).

iv).

b) Assume that you’re designing a web pages for the Cultural event organized in your 8 institution, it has 3 divisions with the header, footer, section which contain event list and brochures of the event. At left side displays list of events and the right side displays the brochures of the event where the second page is a target of link from the first page. Create a student login page using suitable HTML tags. OR
2. a) With suitable example illustrate, how the forms data is packaged into a query string. 8 And explain the two important attributes of any forms. What is the difference between GET and POST?
b) Write a HTML code for creating login page for the Bus Ticket Booking website? 5 UNIT – II

3. a) A CSS provides the properties of making the HTML documents attractive and colorful 8 by adding different predefined and user defined styles to it. With respect to this explain the following CSS tags, with an suitable example :
i) Classes selectors ii) Contextual Selectors iii) ID Selectors iv) Attribute Selectors

b) Absolute positioning is a very powerful positioning mechanism that allows users to 4 place any element wherever they want in an exact location. Explain CSS properties right, left, top, bottom and define the exact locations where you need to place the element. OR
4. a) CSS is used to develop a consistent look and feel for all the pages. Explain about 8 displaying, positioning, and floating an element using CSS.
b) Which CSS property allows you to hide an element but still maintain the space it 4 occupies on the web page UNIT – III

5. a) JavaScript is a text-based programming language used both on the client-side and 8 server-side that allows you to make web pages interactive. Write a simple program in JavaScript to validate the email-id.

b) JavaScript is a scripting language that enables you to create dynamically updating 5 content, control multimedia, animate images, and pretty much everything else. Write a Java script program to print the numbers from 0 to 50 Page 1 of 2 OR

6. a) JavaScript is a language that allows you to implement complex features on web 8 pages. Discuss about JavaScript debugging. Explain how local and global functions can be written using java script
b) JavaScript adds dynamic behavior to the webpage and adds special effects to the 5 webpage. Write a script to demonstrate the use of Date object. UNIT – IV
7. a) PHP uses its own memory and competes well on speed, especially when using the newer 8 versions. Write a program in PHP to calculate Square Root of a number?
b) PHP code has been put to the test in all kinds of real-life environments. Write a program 4 to Associative Arrays in PHP OR

8. a) Write a program in HTML (Web-Page) having a form with firstname, lastname and a 8 submit button. On clicking the button form validation should work (Use Javascript for that) and data entry should be saved in a database (PHP code needed, for insertion of data from “form” to database). Form should be styled using CSS. (Use any mode- inline, internal or external)?

b) PHP is known as a general-purpose scripting language that can be used to develop 4 dynamic and interactive websites. What these tags specify in PHP <?php and ?> ****** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Subject Title: Cryptography and Network Security Subject Code: B18CS7020 - 26722 Time: 90 Minutes                                         Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each unit.  Marks UNIT – I
1.  a) Security mechanism is a process that is designed to detect, prevent, or recover from a 5 security attack. Discuss the following mechanisms.
i) Digital Signature ii) Traffic Padding iii) Notarization iv) Routing Control v) Access Control

b) Shekhar approached State bank of India for Loan. In order to approve the home loan, 8 bank officials requested him to send his PAN card Number and other details via an electronic transfer. For making secure transmission they used a symmetric key encryption algorithm, which uses 128-bit key. Identify the algorithm used for communication. Explain the steps in Encryption and Decryption process for the same with a neat diagram OR

2.  a) Security service is a processing or communication service that enhances the security 6 of the data processing systems and the information transfers of an organization. Elaborate on any three security services that are intended to counter security attacks

b) Mamatha and Kavitha agree to communicate sharing a key of length 56 bits. The 7 message sent between them is of 64 bits length .Suggest an algorithm for communication. Explain function (f) for the same in detail with a neat diagram UNIT – II
2.  a) Depict the overall processing of a message to produce a digest with its steps in Secure 7 Hash function algorithm SHA – 512.
b) Perform Encryption and Decryption using RSA Algorithm      5 p = 3 ; q = 11 ; e = 7 and M = 5 OR

4.  a) The purpose of a hash function is to produce a “fingerprint” of a file, message, or 6 other block of data. Outline the properties of a hash function that is to be useful for message authentication
b) Consider a Diffie – Hellman Scheme with common prime q=11 and a primitive root α 6 = 2
i) If user A has public key YA = 9, what is A’s private key XA ? ii) If user B has public key YB = 3, what is the shared Secret key K ? UNIT – III
5.  a) Kerberos was created by MIT as a solution to the network security problems. Explain 7 the over view of Kerberos version -4.
b) Illustrate the digital service for authentication and confidentiality service provided by 6 PGP giving the sequence. Page 1 of 2 OR
6.  a) Illustrate with the help of a diagram how Pretty Good privacy scheme uses key rings 8 for message Generation.
b) Elaborate on the message header fields defined in MIME specification 5 UNIT – IV
7.  a) Illustrate the Unix password scheme and discuss the possible threats to the scheme 6
b) Illustrate the common types of Firewalls giving its features 6 OR
8.  a) There has been a continuous arms race between virus writers and writers of antivirus 6 software since viruses first appeared. Outline the categories of most significant types of viruses.

b) Illustrate the packet filtering Firewall and Highlight the filtering rules based on the 6 information contained in a Network packet *** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Course (Subject): Augmented and Virtual Reality Course Code: B18CS7041 - 26725 Time: 90 Minutes                                          Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each unit. Marks UNIT – I
1.  a) History always gives a booster, and it is fun to know about the past happenings. 7 Define Augmented reality and write a note about the history of Augmented Reality.
b) A System to be made up of all the components in the design phase. Discuss the 6 system structure of augmented reality OR
2.  a) Building a system to know how it works is an important task. Virtual reality 5 techniques are widely used in these aspects. Brief the different concepts and components of virtual reality.
b) Knowing the upcoming of an area in technology gives us a lot of value addition. 8 Define the term virtual reality and explain the happenings for it to evolve till date. UNIT – II
3.  a) Input devices are very important for getting data to the virtual reality system. 7 Discuss tracking system used as an input device.
b) Visual tools are very useful output devices in a virtual reality system. Discuss 5 visual tools for output in a virtual environment. OR
4.  a) Output system is one with make a system to work as a real time system. Explain 7 haptic devices used as output devices in virtual reality systems.
b) Sounds and audio systems are one of the major output systems in a virtual reality 5 output. Describe the same. UNIT – III
5.  a) Modelling a system is very important for successful outcome of the project. 8 Discuss VR system architecture and explain VR modelling cycle.
b) Series like Angry birds etc. are developed using some physical quantities in mind. 5 Discuss physical based simulation in brief. OR
6.  a) Texture gives a different look to any system. Describe texture mapping with 8 respect virtual reality.
b) A football game is to be simulate in a VR environment. Discuss behavior 5 simulation / modelling for the same. UNIT – IV
7.  a) We require different process and tools to build a virtual reality environment. 7 Discuss the Frameworks of Software Development Tools in VR
b) Tools are very important in development of a virtual environment. Describe 5 unity software and discuss it usage in VR environment. OR Page 1 of 2
8.  a) Virtual reality is used in simulation in major areas. Write a note into VR 7 Technology in Film and TV Production.

b) Compare and contrast MultiGen and Virtools used in VR scenario. 5 *** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Course (Subject): C# And .Net Course Code: B18CS7043 - 26727 Time: 90 Minutes                                          Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each unit. Marks UNIT – I

1.  When you build solutions using a .NET-aware language, you will most likely interact 13 with each of the CTS types. Recall that the CTS is a formal specification that documents how types must be defined in order to be hosted by the CLR. Outline a brief overview of the five types defined by the CTS. OR

2.  The base data types are mainly primitive data types, such as Integer, Double, Date, 13 String, and so on. These include all the types that are part of any .NET programming language. List in a table all the intrinsic CTS Data Types mentioning the corresponding C# keyword. UNIT – II

3.  Demonstrate a C# program to pass a reference type by value by considering the 12 following points a. Is it possible alter objects state data if an object is passed by value type? Justify the statement. b. Is it possible is to reassign what the reference is pointing to if it passed as a value type? Justify the statement. OR
4.  C# provides a set of parameter modifiers that control how arguments are sent into a 12 given method. Explain various method parameter modifiers with example for each. UNIT – III
5.  a) All object-oriented languages contend with three core principles of object-oriented 6 programming, often called the famed “pillars of OOP.” Describe each pillar OOP with example.

b) Interface-based programming is an architectural pattern for implementing modular 7 programming at the component level in an object-oriented programming language which does not have a module system. C# supports for interface-based programming. Define interfaces in C#. How to invoke interface members at the object level. OR

6.  a) Describe the property syntax for get block and set block and how it is different from 7 traditional accessor and mutator methods. Write a C# program which contains class called Student with data member’s name, SRN, College. Assign and display the data only through get and set block.
b) C# language doesn't support multiple inheritance of classes, so Interfaces are 6 needed. Define interfaces in C#. How to invoke interface members at the object level. UNIT – IV

7.  a) In a computer, software anomaly is categorized in to the three Errors, Bugs, and 6 Exceptions anomaly-centric terms define these terms and list the four key elements required for structured exception handling along with the keywords offered by C# to manage runtime exceptions. Page 1 of 2

b) The Zen of .NET memory management says this: Allocate an object onto the 6 managed heap using the "new" keyword and forget about it. Once "new-ed," the CLR removes the object when it is no longer needed. Explain in detail how does the runtime determine when an object is "no longer needed"? OR

8.  a) Object lifetime is the time when a block of memory is allocated to this object during 7 some process of execution and that block of memory is released when the process ends. Express the rules that can be applied for basics of object lifetime. Summarize the rules that are applied for object lifetime.

b) Objects to clean up any unmanaged resources that they're holding so that memory 5 is utilized efficiently, its allowed by GC. Discuss the finalization process supported by GC in detail. *** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Course (Subject): Natural Language Processing Course Code: B18CS7044 - 26728 Time: 90 minutes                                        Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each unit. Marks UNIT – I 1  a) Consider a mini-corpus of three sentences. Each sentence with a special 10 symbol <s> at the beginning of the sentence, special end </s> symbol. <s> I am Sam </s> <s> Sam I am </s> <s> I do not like green eggs and ham </s> Write out the equation for bigram probability estimation. Calculate the bigram probabilities from this corpus.

b) A natural language is any language that has evolved naturally in humans 3 through use and repetition without conscious planning or premeditation. What is Natural Language Processing? Illustrate why NLP is hard? OR

2.  a) After the breakthrough of GPT-3 with its ability to write essays, code and also 5 create images from text, Google announced its new trillion-parameter AI language model that’s almost 6 times bigger than GPT-3. Explain why do we need text normalization? Illustrate how do we achieve it?

b) Language models offer a way to assign a probability to a sentence or other 8 sequence of words, and to predict a word from preceding words. Demonstrate n-grams are Markov models that estimate words from a fixed window of previous words. UNIT – II

3.  a) Automatic speech recognition is a technology that converts speech to text in 7 real time. ASR may also be called speech-to-text or, simply, transcription systems. Illustrate how automatic speech recognition works?

b) A syllable is a single, unbroken vowel sound within a spoken word. They 5 typically contain a vowel or two if one is silent, and perhaps one or more accompanying consonants. Distinguish between open syllable and closed syllable. OR 4  a) Explain the following terms with appropriate examples   6 I. phone II. diphone III. syllables

b) MFCCs are a compact representation of the spectrum of an audio signal. How 6 can we convert the audio signal into coefficients and what do these coefficients exactly represent? UNIT – III Page 1 of 2 5  a) Dynamic programming approaches systematically fill in tables of solutions to 8 sub-problems. When complete, the tables contain the solution to all the sub problems needed to solve the problem as a whole. Illustrate Earley algorithm uses a dynamic programming approach to efficiently implement a parallel top-down search.

b) CYK algorithm is a parsing algorithm for context free grammar. In order to 5 apply CYK algorithm to a grammar, it must be in Chomsky Normal Form. It uses a dynamic programming algorithm to tell whether a string is in the language of a grammar. Illustrate the steps involved CYK algorithm OR 6  a) One that is most commonly used in computational is the Chomsky hierarchy 5 which includes four kinds of grammars, Explain with a neat Venn diagram languages on Chomsky hierarchy.

b) A probabilistic context free grammar consists of terminal and nonterminal 8 variables. Each feature to be modeled has a production rule that is assigned a probability estimated from a training set. Summarize the general steps for utilizing PCFGs in various scenarios UNIT – IV

7.  a) The meaning of a language can be seen from its relation between words, i.e. 6 the sense of one word is related to the sense of another. Illustrate the terms synonymy, antonymy, homonomy, hyponymy, Meronymy, polysemy taxonomy with appropriate example.

b) Machine translation is the process of using artificial intelligence (AI) to 6 automatically translate content from one language (the source) to another (the target) without any human input. Can statistical techniques be used to perform the task of machine translation? If so, explain in brief. OR

8.  a) Information Retrieval (IR) can be defined as a software program that deals 10 with the organization, storage, retrieval, and evaluation of information from document repositories, particularly textual information Explain the architecture of an Information Retrieval system with a neat diagram.

b) Translation is the process of changing written text created in one language 2 into another language. Will Machine Translation replace human translators? Explain in brief. ****** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Course Title: Data science using R Course Code: B18CS7051 - 26729 Time:  90 Minutes                                          Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each Unit.   Marks UNIT – I

1. a) R is the most popular language in the world of Data Science. It is heavily used in 7 analyzing data that is both structured and unstructured. This has made R, the standard language for performing statistical operations. Outline the salient features and limitations of R.
b) Interfaces form a contract between the class and the outside world, and this contract is 6 enforced at build time by the compiler. Describe various connection interfaces in R OR

2. a) Every programming language has its own data types (Objects) to store values or any 7 information so that the user can assign these data types to the variables and perform operations respectively. Illustrate with examples the various objects in R

b) To create a matrix in R you need to use the function called matrix (). The arguments to 6 this matrix () are the set of elements in the vector. Create the matrix in R using above function and illustrate with examples the various Matrix operations. UNIT – II

3. a) dplyr is a grammar of data manipulation, providing a consistent set of verbs that help 6 you solve the most common data manipulation challenges. Illustrate any three functions available in dplyr package with suitable examples.
b) Control structures in R allow you to control the flow of execution of a series of R 6 expressions. Illustrate any three control structures in R with suitable examples. OR

4. a) The operation of a loop function involves iterating over an R object (e.g., a list or vector 6 or matrix), applying a function to each element of the object, and the collating the results and returning the collated results. Explain with examples the various loop functions available in R.
b) Define Lazy evaluation and … Argument and explain the same by taking a suitable 6 example. UNIT – III

5. a) Graphs in R language is a preferred feature which is used to create various types of 7 graphs and charts for visualizations. Explain how to create bar graphs, scatter plot, line graph and histogram in R.
b) in R A line graph is a type of chart used to show information that changes over time. 6 Explain How will you add points to line graph and how will you make line graph with multiple lines. OR

6. a) With large data sets, the points in a scatter plot may overlap and obscure each other 7 and prevent the viewer from accurately assessing the distribution of the data. This is called overplotting. Explain the different methods used to deal with over plotting in scatter plot. Page 1 of 2
b) Continuous variables are numeric variables that have an infinite number of values 6 between any two values. Describe how to map a continuous variable to color or size. UNIT – IV

7. a) Data Transformation is one of the key aspects of working for business data analysis, 6 data science or even for the pre-work of artificial intelligence. Explain data transformations for individual predictors and multiple predictors in R.

b) For models predicting a numeric outcome, some measure of accuracy is typically used 6 to evaluate the effectiveness of the model. Explain the various ways of Measuring Performance in Regression Models OR

8. a) Regression analysis is a group of statistical processes used in R programming and 6 statistics to determine the relationship between dataset variables. Discuss Linear Regression and Multiple Linear Regression and different types of Errors.

b) R Non-linear regression is a regression analysis method to predict a target variable 6 using a non-linear function consisting of parameters and one or more independent variables. Illustrate with diagrams the Nonlinear regression Neural Networks model on R. ****** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Course Title: Deep Learning Course Code: B18CS7052 - 26730 Time: 90 Minutes                                          Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each Unit.   Marks UNIT – I 1  a) Define Conditional Probability. Discuss Conditional Probability for 5 dependent events, independent events and mutually exclusive events

b) Suppose that there are two electrical components. The chance that the first 8 component fails is 10%. If the first component fails, the chance that the second component fails is 20%. But if the first component works, the chance that the second component fails is 5%. Calculate the probabilities of the following events: i. At least one of the component works ii. Exactly one of the components works iii. The second component works OR
2.  a) Biological Neurons are the inspiration for the design of Neural Networks. 5 Illustrate the Artificial Neural Network architecture relating to Neuron in human brain.

b) Eigenvalues and eigenvectors allow us to "reduce" a linear operation to 8 separate or simpler problems. Find the eigen values and eigen vectors for the following matrix. [3 2 3 8] UNIT – II 3  a) List and briefly explain various kinds of tasks a learning algorithm can be 3 applied.
b) Optimization is a big part of machine learning. Almost every machine 4 learning algorithm has an optimization algorithm at its core. Discuss the Gradient Descent algorithm in detail

c) Using Linear regression equation, Solve the given problem: 5 PERSON      RATING FOR       RATING FOR MOVIE 1          MOVIE 2 1st            4                3 2nd            2                4 3rd            3                2 4th            5                5 5th            1                3 6th            3                1 i. Find the value of b and b 0    1 ii. Find the regression line iii. If a new person rates movie 1 as 3, then predict the rating of the same person for movie 2. Page 1 of 2 OR

4.  a) Define Machine Learning. With respect to the following problems, identify 3 the Task T, Performance Measure P and Experience E: i. A checkers learning problem: ii. A handwriting recognition learning problem:

b) Solve the following problem by dividing the following data into 2 clusters 9 using k-means algorithm Height 185 170 168 179 182 188 180 180 183 180 180 177 Weight 72 56 60 68  72  77 71  70 84  88 67  76 UNIT – III
a) Activation function plays a major role in working of a Neural Network. 7 Discuss the Activation functions used in ANN in detail
b) Using Perceptron training rule, design AND, OR logic gates 6 OR
6. a) Using Perceptron training rule, design XOR gate          3
b) Distinguish between the variants of gradient descent algorithm along with 5 their advantages of each variant
c) ANN has an interdisciplinary approach in its development and applications. 5 List and discuss the various applications of ANN. UNIT – IV
a) Define RNN. Explain the working of RNN along with its advantages, 5 disadvantages and applications
b) Discuss different stages in NLP Pipeline along with suitable examples 7 OR
8. a) Machines understanding the human languages is the current research trend. Define NLP. Describe its components along with the advantage and 5 disadvantages.

b) Discuss the two approaches to build a recommender system along with suitable examples.                                        7 Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B Tech Semester End Examination Jan 2022 Course Title: Business Intelligence and Process Management Course Code: B18CS7054 - 26732 Time: 90 Minutes                                          Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each Unit.   Marks UNIT – I

1. a) The Business Environment in which the organizations operate today is becoming 7 more complex. Illustrate the concept of Business Pressures Responses Support Model with a block diagram. –         –
b) The data warehouse is the cornerstone of any medium-to-large BI system. 6 Explain the High-Level Architecture of Business Intelligence with a block diagram. OR
2. a) Business Intelligence implementation depends on which tools are used. Explain 7 the major tools and techniques of Business Intelligence with the help of computerized tools for decision support.

b) A decision support system (DSS) is an interactive information system that 6 analyzes large volumes of data for informing business decisions. Describe the automated decision-making framework with a block diagram. UNIT – II
3. a) Data Warehouse is a system used for reporting and data analysis and is 6 considered a core component of business intelligence. Illustrate the fundamental characteristics of data warehouse.
b) A data warehousing process consists of Extract, Transform and Load (ETL). 6 Demonstrate the ETL process with a block diagram. OR

4. a) Organizations continuously collect data, information, and knowledge at an 6 increasingly accelerated rate and store them in computerized systems. Make use of the above statement with a brief explanation of two-tier, three-tier and web- based data warehousing architectures with a neat diagram.

b) Active Data Warehousing is the technical ability to capture transactions when 6 they change and integrate them into the warehouse. Compare and contrast traditional data warehousing environment v/s active data warehousing environment. UNIT – III
5. a) Virtually every BI application requires database or data warehouse access. 7 Illustrate the multi-tiered application architecture with a neat block diagram.
b) Business intelligence (BI) is one of the most significant data integration use 6 cases. Explain the major factors that affect the decision-making process of BI implementation. Page 1 of 2 OR

6. a) On-demand BI model is a cost-effective alternative to overly complex and 7 expensive analytic reporting solutions. Explain the key characteristics and benefits of On-demand BI along with its limitations.
b) Ethics in decision making and support is very important. Illustrate the model of 6 ethical problem formulation with a block diagram. UNIT – IV

7. a) Workflow management systems have been identified as an important step in the 6 evolution of business process management systems. Illustrate workflow management systems architecture with a block diagram.

b) Flexible workflow management is well suited to supporting business processes 6 with static control structures. In the flexible workflow management, explain the concepts of conceptual design and dynamic adaptations by example with block diagrams. OR

8. a) Web services are the current realization of service-oriented computing, and it 6 provides an important milestone in the quest towards service-oriented architectures. Demonstrate the recommendations that provide the underpinning of Web services development with a block diagram of main world wide web consortium web services recommendations.

b) The business process management methodology is the way your organization 6 approaches your processes. Explain the business process methodology with a block diagram. ****** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B.Tech Semester End Examination Feb 2022 Course (Subject): Human Computer Interaction Course Code: B18CS7061 - 26733 Time: 90 Minutes                                           Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each unit.  Marks UNIT – I
1.  a) Summarize the model of the structure of human memory with diagrammatic 9 illustration?
b) State Gestalt theory.                                       4 OR
2.  a) List out the devices used for virtual reality and 3d interaction in computer. Discuss 9 any two in detail.
b) Illustrate the basic assumptions of the Fitts' Law model    4 UNIT – II

3.  a) The designer does not begin with some preconceived idea. Rather, the idea is the 8 result of careful study and observation, and the design a product of that idea. Illustrate the various steps for Interaction design process?
b) Explain the concept of Ergonomics with suitable examples.   4 OR
4.  a) Explain in detail about interaction design process using block diagram 8
b) Explain in detail the Global structure hierarchical organization? 4 UNIT – III

5.  a) Explain the Principles to support usability. Consider the following usability objective. 9 Theatre booking clerks with low motivation, no computing experience and no previous training, working in a small and hectic box office, are able to learn to reserve or book seats within a one hour period. What measure could be taken and which techniques would you consider appropriate to test whether this objective was met?
b) List out and Shneiderman’s eight Golden rules of interface design 4 OR
6.  a) Explain Norman’s seven principle for transferring difficult task to simple one in design 9
b) Discuss in detail about the activities in waterfall model of software life cycle? 4 UNIT – IV
7. a) Describe Nielen's Heuristic Evaluation method: What steps comprise it, how and 8 where is it used, how many evaluators are recommended, and where do the heuristics come from?"
b) Indicate the tradeoffs between Heuristic Evaluation and traditional user testing? 4 OR Page 1 of 2
8. a) Explain about the factors that influence for choosing evaluation techniques. Outline 8 the approaches used for evaluating through expert analysis?

b) Discuss the concept of goal of evaluation.                   4 ****** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B.Tech Semester End Examination Feb 2022 Course (Subject): Computer Graphics and Animation Course Code: B18CS7062 - 26734 Time: 90 minutes                                         Max. Marks: 50 Note: Answer ONE FULL question from each unit. UNIT – I                         Marks

1.  a) OpenGL is a cross-language, cross-platform application programming interface 6 for rendering 2D and 3D vector graphics. Describe the various OpenGL functions. Also give any 5 geometric primitives specified by the set of vertices.

b) Sierpinski triangle is a fractal and attractive fixed set with the overall shape of 7 an equilateral triangle which subdivides recursively into smaller triangles. Construct an OpenGL program to design 3D sierpinski Gasket by dividing the tetrahedron by 20 times. OR

2.  a) A pinhole camera is a simple camera without a lens but with a tiny aperture. 6 Explain the concept of pinhole camera which is an example of an imaging system. Derive the expression for angle of view. Also indicate the advantages and disadvantages of this.

b) Sierpinski triangle is a fractal and attractive fixed set with the overall shape of 7 an equilateral triangle which subdivides recursively into smaller triangles. Construct an OpenGL program to design 2D sierpinski Gasket by dividing the triangle by 30 times. UNIT – II

3.  a) Event-driven programming is the dominant paradigm used in graphical user 6 interfaces and other applications that are centered on performing certain actions in response to user input. Explain how the events can be generated by using Mouse and Keyboard. Generate the program to draw a small box at each location on the screen where the mouse is cursor is located.

b) The geometric transformations play a vital role in generating images of 3D 6 objects with the help of the transformations. Illustrate on 3D transformations (translation, scaling and rotation) in homogenous coordinate system. OR
4.  a) Develop an OpenGL code to develop a colored cube and make the cube to rotate 6 along x,y and z axis by using mouse interaction. The speed of rotation need to be controlled trough keyboard.

b) Transformations play an important role in computer graphics to reposition the 6 graphics on the screen and change their size or orientation. Explain the concatenation of transformation matrices. Derive the concatenated final matrix M for rotating a 3D object about a fixed point. UNIT – III
5.  a) Explain the graphics functions gluLookAt(), glOrtho(), glFrustum(), 6 gluPerspective() with suitable examples. Also determine the final projection matrices for parallel viewing.

b) Construct the OpenGL program for demonstrating the cohen sutherland line 7 Page 1 of 2 clipping algorithm for clipping the line having the two end points at (60,20) and (80,120). Consider the clipping rectangle at (50,50) and (100,100). OR

6.  a) Projection is a technique or process which is used to transform a 3D object into a 6 2D plane. Explain Orthographic, Axonometric, Oblique, Perspective and Parallel Projections in Classical Viewing.

b) The Liang-Barsky algorithm is more efficient than Cohen–Sutherland line clipping 7 algorithm and can be extended to 3-Dimensional clipping. Construct the OpenGL program for demonstrating the Liang-Barsky algorithm for clipping the line having the two end points at (60,20) and (80,120). Consider the clipping rectangle at (50,50) and (100,100). UNIT – IV
7.  a) The drawing tools in Flash let us create and modify shapes for the artwork in our 6 movies. Explain the following tools,
i) Drawing and Painting Tools ii) Colour iii) Adding Sound

b) Frame-by-frame animation changes the contents of the Stage in every frame and 6 is best suited to complex animation in which an image changes in every frame instead of simply moving. Frame-by-frame animation increases file size more rapidly than tweened animation Use frame-by-frame animation when one needs to change an image in each frame. Explain the steps involved in animation of movie created frame by frame. OR
8.  a) Flash is Windows-based software where we can start it using the Start menu 6 button and then clicking at the Flash submenus and options. Explain the following in Flash work environment.
i) Stage and Time line ii) Symbols and Instances iii) Toolbox iv) Panels
b) Layers are transparent sheets of acetate stacked on top of each other over which 6 the objects are drawn. Give the procedure for the following,
i) Add a layer ii) Delete a layer, iii) Hide a layer iv) Properties reset

v) Update the stacking order of layers. ****** Page 2 of 2 SRN 7th Semester B.Tech Semester End Examination Feb 2022 Course (Subject): Advanced Web Technology Course Code: B18CS7064 - 26736 Time: 90 minutes                                          Max. 1.  a) The term HTML5 is essentially a buzzword that refers to a set of modern web 7 technologies.HTML5 introduces a number of new elements and attributes that can help you in building modern websites. Discuss the most prominent features introduced in HTML5.
